statement: F. Buy One, Get One Freetime limit per test5 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstdinoutputstdoutA nearby pie shop is having a special sale. For each pie you pay full price for, you may select one pie of a strictly lesser value to get for free. Given the prices of all the pies you wish to acquire, determine the minimum total amount you must pay for all of the pies.InputInput will begin with an integern(1 ≤n≤ 500000), the number of pies you wish to acquire. You are buying pies. For every pie you buy at full price, you get a cheaper pie for free. The prices of all the pies are given. Find the minimum amount of money you need to spend to buy all the pies. 

Input:

* The first line contains an integer $n$ (1 ≤ $n$ ≤ 500000), the number of pies.
* The second line contains $n$ integers, each representing the price of a pie. All prices are positive integers not exceeding $10^9$.

Output:

* Print the minimum cost to buy all the pies.
You have a list of prices for items. You can buy one item at full price and get a cheaper item for free. Find the cheapest way to buy all the items.
